intro: Zanthoxylum valens, commonly known as the Mexican prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces red, berry-like fruits that are edible but have a sharp, tangy flavor. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies. Zanthoxylum valens thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forests and along riverbanks.
